de.esoco.lib.collection

Class IntArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.collection.IntArray

  • public class IntArray
extends java.lang.Object
    A dynamic array of integers that can grow and shrink to hold an arbitrary number of int values.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
      The default capacity for new array instances

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntArray()
      Default constructor, creates a new instance with an initial capacity of DEFAULT_CAPACITY integers.
      IntArray(int nCapacity)
      Creates a new instance with the given capacity.
      IntArray(int[] rData)
      Creates a new instance from an int array.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_CAPACITY

        public static final int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
        The default capacity for new array instances
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntArray

        public IntArray()
        Default constructor, creates a new instance with an initial capacity of DEFAULT_CAPACITY integers.

      • IntArray

        public IntArray(int[] rData)
        Creates a new instance from an int array.
        Parameters:
        rData - The data to be copied into this instance

      • IntArray

        public IntArray(int nCapacity)
        Creates a new instance with the given capacity. The capacity increment size will be set to the initial capacity.
        Parameters:
        nCapacity - The initial capacity of the array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the capacity is negative

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int nValue)
        Adds an integer value to the end of the array.
        Parameters:
        nValue - The value to add

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all entries from the array. The array's size will be 0 afterwards, it's capacity will not be changed.

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(int[] rDst,
                   int nOffset)
        Copies the contents of this array to an simple integer array. The destination array must have a length of at least getSize() + nOffset, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        rDst - The destination array to copy the array data into
        nOffset - The start position in the destination array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the destination array is to small

      • ensureCapacity

        public void ensureCapacity(int nMinCapacity)
        Checks if the current capacity fits a certain minimum and to increase the capacity it if necessary.
        Parameters:
        nMinCapacity - The minimum capacity required by the operation that invoked this method

      • get

        public int get(int nIndex)
        Returns the integer value at a particular position in the array.
        Parameters:
        nIndex - The position in the array
        Returns:
        The integer value at the given position
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index value is invalid

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the current capacity (i.e. the maximum number of integer values in the array).
        Returns:
        The current capacity of the array

      • getCapacityIncrement

        public int getCapacityIncrement()
        Return the amount by which the array capacity will be incremented when the size exceeds the current capacity.
        Returns:
        The capacity increment

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the current size of the array, i.e. the number of integer values stored in it.
        Returns:
        The number of integer values in the array

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(int nValue,
                   int nPos)
        Searches for a specific value and returns the position of it's first occurence in the array from a certain position.
        Parameters:
        nValue - The value to search for
        nPos - The position to start at
        Returns:
        The first position of the value in the array or -1 if not found

      • insert

        public void insert(int nValue,
                   int nIndex)
        Inserts an integer value at an arbitrary position of the array. All values at and behind this position will be shifted one position to the end of the array. If the array capacity is exceeded the array will be resized.
        Parameters:
        nValue - The value to add
        nIndex - The index of the position where the value shall be inserted
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index value is invalid

      • insertAscending

        public int insertAscending(int nValue,
                           int nStart)
        Inserts a value into the array at a position corresponding to it's ascending numerical order. All values that are greater than the new value will be shifted one position to the end of the array. If the current array capacity is not sufficient the array will be resized.

        If the parameter nStart is greater than 0, the values at the array positions before nStart will be ignored by the insertion. This allows to keep a set of unordered values at the beginning of the array.

        Parameters:
        nValue - The value to insert into the array
        nStart - The position to start comparing values
        Returns:
        The position at which the new value has been inserted

      • last

        public int last()
        Returns the last integer value (stored at size -1) in the array.
        Returns:
        The integer value stored at the end of the array

      • pop

        public int pop()
        Returns the last integer value and removes it from the array.
        Returns:
        The last integer value in the array
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the array is empty

      • push

        public void push(int nValue)
        Adds an integer value to the end of the array (stack version, calls add()).
        Parameters:
        nValue - The value to add

      • remove

        public void remove(int nIndex)
        Removes a value from a certain index position in the array. All values behind that index will be shifted one position to the beginning of the array.
        Parameters:
        nIndex - The position at which a value shall be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index value is invalid

      • set

        public void set(int nValue,
                int nIndex)
        Sets a new integer value at an arbitrary position of the array.
        Parameters:
        nValue - The new value to set
        nIndex - The index of the position where the value shall be set
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index value is invalid

      • setCapacityIncrement

        public void setCapacityIncrement(int nIncrement)
        Sets the amount by which the array capacity will be incremented when the size exceeds the current capacity.
        Parameters:
        nIncrement - The capacity increment

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int nNewSize)
        Sets the size, i.e. the number of integer values that the array contains. If the new size is greater than the current size, new integers with the value 0 will be added to the end of the array. If the new size extends the current array capacity the capacity will be increased accordingly.
        Parameters:
        nNewSize - The new number of integer values in the array

      • toIntArray

        public int[] toIntArray()
        Converts this array into an integer array containing all values. The length of the new array will be exactly the same as the size (not the capacity) of the IntArray.
        Returns:
        int[]

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the array in the form "IntArray[value1,...,valueN]".
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String representing the array

      • trimToSize

        public void trimToSize()
        Shrinks the array capacity to it's current size.

      • checkCapacity

        protected final void checkCapacity(int nIncrement)
        Lets the array capacity grow for at least a certain size increment.
        Parameters:
        nIncrement - The minimum increment for which the capacity shall grow

      • checkIndex

        protected final void checkIndex(int nIndex)
                         throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Checks if a certain index position is valid for the current array size.
        Parameters:
        nIndex - The index value to check
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given index value is not valid for the current array size

      • setCapacity

        protected final void setCapacity(int nNewCapacity)
        Resizes the array to a certain capacity. The new capacity must always be greater or equal to the current array size.
        Parameters:
        nNewCapacity - The new array capacity
